Be spirited away to Bath this Halloween Published on : Thursday, October 15, 2015
Whether you are looking for the fright of your life or just an opportunity to dress up, Bath has activities and ghoulish goings on to appeal to kids and adults alike.
Tales of spirits lurking in the streets and scary activities for children, Bath’s spine-tingling events await you.
Halloween Festival at Longleat
Longleat’s Halloween Festival gives way to a range of activities, perfect for all the different ways your children want to celebrate Halloween. Activities include ‘Ghost Tours’ and ‘Nasty but Nice Shows’ for those looking for a thrill, or a ‘Trick or Treat Trail’ and ‘Spooky Face Painting’ for younger or more sensitive children. There are also fireworks on selected nights, so be ready to finish your day with a bang.
The Halloween Festival takes place 23 rd October – 1 st November. Tickets are £28 per adult and £20.35 per child.
Halloween at Prior Park
Head to Prior Park for a Halloween trail, where you will discover ghoulish creatures of all shapes and sizes. Enjoy a day of fresh air as you walk through the gardens and discover all the mysteries awaiting you on the outdoor trail.
The trail is open 24 th -31 st October, 10am-4pm. Tickets are £6.20 per adult and £3.40 per child.
Spooky events at The American Museum
The Holburne Museum is hosting a series of events, such as a Haunted Story Trail (28 th October), creepy craft classes (29 th October) and Day of the Dead celebrations (30 th October). Meet ghosts from America’s past and create decorations for the Day of the Dead parade.
Tickets are £10 per adult and £5.50 per child.
Ghost Walks of Bath
Ghost Walks of Bath takes you on an hour and a half guided walk of the most haunted areas of Bath, where ominous sightings have regularly occurred. Learn these ghosts and why they might be haunting the area still.
Feel a chill to the spine as you encounter spirits in the dark and learn about their haunted past. Some stories may chill your blood as others will enchant you.
Tickets are £8 per adult and £6 per child.
